p: By GC–MS analysis, 13 compounds constituting the essential oil of B. morelensis, were obtained. The most abundant was γ-Terpinene (65.46%), followed by β-Phellandrene (18.27%). Carrera et al. [ 12] performed an analysis of the essential oil of B. morelensis collected in August and September 2012. They reported 23 compounds, of which 13 are present in the essential oil in this research. The compounds present can be directly related to the season in which samples were collected. Many factors can affect the chemical composition of the essential oils, such as, geographic location of the plants, surrounding climate, seasonal variations, stress during growth, plant ecotype or variety, plant nutrition and application of fertilizers [ 17].
